review: Taken 2 Clarithromycin 500mg a day for 5 days, bit of bowel movement throughout the following second day, but not too bad, one evening of constant cramp like pain, but okay the next day. It does leave like a horrible bitter taste in your mouth, that didn't start until the fourth day, cleared  my sinuses pretty well & my very bad headache, has started to clear, and  as the high pitched noise in my ears has gone. I found them to be a little big, easy enough to swallow & found it better to have one in the morning & early evening. I found it better to take them before & an hour or so after food.

A few hours after taking the first tablet there was a bitter taste in my mouth which became increasingly worse as the day progressed, a similar taste to hand sanitizer or nail polish remover (if you’ve ever accidentally licked your fingers after,) almost unbearably bitter.It really hits the back of your throat inevitably making you feel quiet nauseous in the end, as if you have been drinking something that’s not good for you, slight stomach cramps until in finally starts to ease a few hours before the next dose.I found chewing minty gum during the day helped, drinking wine in the evening took the taste away and made me sleepy enough when the next dose kicked in so as I could sleep through the horrible taste!

When taking clarithromycin for the first time, all I can say it has been the best medication that has helped my sinuses straight away when taking just one tablet, normally it would take 2-3 days before I would feel a little better with other medication but clarithromycin helped me get much. I got better sleep within the first night, however all I can say is occasionally I was woken up with the metallic taste in my mouth and the feeling of nausea, but I can deal a lot better with those symptoms for 7 days then to have sleepless nights from sinusitis

I was prescribed clarithromycin  500mg every 12hrs (twice daily) for 10 days by my ENT consultant after I used  Doxy for 7 days without relief for my bacterial infection. I started feeling better after the third dose and didn't have any major side effect. I had yogurt before and after taking the medication.  By day four I was hit by all the side effects in the book. I started going to the toilet twice a day (bowel movement). My normal  routine is once. I experienced headache, body and muscle ache, fatigue, metallic taste in the mouth and generally feeling unwell. By the time I completed my 10 days almost all my sinusitis symptoms where gone. I still experienced the full blown side effects of this medication headache, body and muscle ache, fatigue, metallic taste in the mouth and generally feeling unwell for 5 days after completing the dose. Did it clear my infection YES. Will I use this again NO. It is way too strong for me.

Started a course of clarythromycin yesterday for a recurring scalp psoriasis, I'd taken it before as it was the only thing that helped in the end as all the medicated shampoos antihistamines & creams weren't really getting to the root of the bacterial infection in my skin. I had the same side effects as I did the first time I took it mostly a persistent metallic taste on my mouth alleviated somewhat by hard sweets/lucozade type drinks; also a spaciousness fogginess feeling that makes rational thinking & conversation somewhat difficult; I have scoliosis anyway so am on strong codeine for the pain but this medicine seems to worsen the lower back pain but as much psoriasis is improving day by day & remembering how it worked before I will persist until the end of the course also make sure you take the medicine with or after food or the nausea kicks in very quickly.

The side effect of bitter taste in my mouth is awful but not as bad as the sinus pain I had. It took 4 days of taking the medication for it to really work and the painful face to go but it definitely eased after 2 days. I can tolerate the weird taste because that pain was awful. I'm just glad I'm not the only one who has experienced it as I thought I was going crazy.
Just woken in the middle of the night with this FOUL taste In my mouth. It’s horrendous and I’m having bad stomach cramps at the top of my stomach. There’s no way I’m taking another one tommorow.

I was prescribed a 7 day course of 500mg (2 a day) of clarithromycin for a particularly bad dose of sinusitis and an ear infection.I wish I had read the reviews before I started taking it as I will never take it again.First couple of days everything was OK, then the anxiety started coupled with a racing heart and palpitations. Got so bad I had to go to the A&E to get checked out. I then had the worst acid reflux I have ever experienced I've been in so much pain. It has now been 5 days since I stopped taking them. Yesterday was the first day I didn't have any palpitations and after getting some omeprazole from the chemist the acid reflux is starting to lift slightly.To be honest my ear infection would have been preferable to what I've been through the past few days.Avoid at all costs!!
Took this for 3 days. Ended up in ER with terrible vertigo and sickness. Disoriented and can’t go to work. I would avoid this drug.

RUN don’t walk away from this medicine. I have a TERRIBLE metallic taste in my mouth and the AWFUL nausea that goes with it. I would honestly rather have the worst sinus infection in the world than take this medicine for another day.

Not entirely sure what rating to give this. I’ve been taking This antibiotic for 4 days for sinus congestion + Eustachian tube blockage... Not sure if it’s normal to have it kick in by now or not? I do feel a slight relief of pressure in my middle ear, I’m assuming that means it’s working? Help?

I suffer from chronic sinusitis with around 4 flare ups if acute each year. My sinuses are so painful that a metallic taste from clarithromycin is worth having. I am on the second day of this course clarithromycin 500mg twice a day. I can already feel some improvement and I have 12 days to go.  I have a lot of underlying health issues including cancer and side effects are a given for strong medication. I usually take Doxycycline from which I have far worse stomach symptoms. I think this drug is great for clearing up severe infections. I have taken both with and without food. The only thing I religiously do is drink a full glass of water with them.

I got this antibiotic what would have been 3 days ago today. The first day I had a complete break down and cried my eyes out. I was extremely emotional and depressed feeling hopeless and felt like I was losing my mind. I couldn’t stop crying. I have a metallic taste in my mouth and have had headaches every day. Last night I was all of a sudden having excruciating stomach cramps I couldn’t stand or sit or lay down the pain was unbearable. I considered calling 911 because the pain was so bad but settled for 811 health link instead. I thought I was dying. It took hot pads and pain killers to even be able to lay down. Today I am stuck on the couch (husbands orders) and after last night my stomach is still very tender and cramping but nothing compared to how it was. I would suggest never taking this medication. It was an absolute nightmare and I will NEVER take this again, it shouldn’t even be prescribed to people. It is absolute poison.

I’m currently on day 6 of this medication and I haven’t noticed any improvement whatsoever. When the medication wasn’t working and I started getting pain in my top rear molars I made an appointment with my dentist. They checked everything yesterday and told me there’s no tooth infection (even though I feel pressure in my teeth)... I don’t know why I still have sore cheek bones, pressure around my nose and eye, swollen lymph nodes.. and this awful medication isn’t helping at all. It’s super discouraging. I don’t know what’s wrong with me but I’m going to finish the full course (4days left). The one thing I did find odd is I haven’t experienced this gross metal taste everyone else is talking about? I’ve had a whole other slew of TERRIBLE side effects that have made me call a nurse at 2am though...
Made me feel like someone sprayed hairspray in my mouth. So nauseous, bloated. Severe headaches. Feels like sound is so distant

This clarithromycin gave me a very poor experience. I am 3/4 the way through taking the course and I threw it in the trash. If you have anxiety do NOT take this drug. I have never had worse insomnia from an antibiotic. All day I feel tired and then at night I am sleepless. In addition to this the nausea makes it very difficult to eat. I am in my mid 20s and never thought something as simple as an antibiotic could do this. As far as treating the sinus infection it went away but I am still experiencing a runny nose
clarithromycin cleared up my sinus infection temporarily but then it came back. Also gave me super bad hypoglycemia (low blood sugar levels)

Was prescribed clarithromycin for sinusitis and ear infection after zpack didn’t kick it. Took it until the 4 day of the 10 days course before I had to call doc with s.o.s. The metallic taste & little bit of stomach upset were okay but by night 4 I had the headache of death, and woke up every morning a little shaky with a headache. Awful. When the cure is worse than the disease. Was represcribed Cefuroxime Axetil so we’ll see if this can kick whatever it is making me bleh without killing me in the process.

Biaxin (clarithromycin):One dose of this medicine  Biaxin left me with severe heart arythmia and messed with my mind. I felt like I was on LCD. I took it once before a couple decades ago and had similar but lesser side effects. I'm not sure if I was prescribed a larger than normal dose since I was in Germany, but the side effects are very dangerous.

Have had sinus infections for over twenty years and although two operations have helped they can still recur  and are very nasty. Usually along with the sinus pain, I lose my voice with nasal drip and my breathing is affected with accompanying chest pain. Clarithromycin  was recommended by my consultant years ago and although my GP was reluctant he did agree to write the prescription when needed and has continued to do so.This drug is amazing for me. Literally within a few hours I can feel the pressure lifting from my sinuses, my voice starts to return and the weight lifts from my chest and I can breath properly again. Within a few days I am  back to normal.I ALWAYS take the tablet with food as per the instructions. If you don't you can get into all sorts of trouble as listed by others here. I have worried that I may become resistant to it as I probably take it twice a year but if anything it seems to be more effective for me as I get older. Not sure why.
Made me cough so much I thought my head was going to explode never again

I have recurring sinus infections and I'm currently taking this drug for the 4th time. Before I took it, I was reading reviews of how awful this drug was and it totally freaked me out.  The side effects are not ideal but you'll survive. I've always found clarithromycin to be super effective and my sinus issues usually improve in two days.  The metallic taste is pretty bad, I'll admit that.  Sleeping is difficult but I take mine with some milk before I go to bed and it keeps the stomachaches at bay.

The doctor  prescribed  clarithromycin for a sinus infection.  I was really concerned after reading the reviews. My experience was positive. I only took the tablet with food, the nausea sensation only when my belly was empty; I had the metal taste in my mouth but sucking a lollie that quickly went away. I was very fatigued on this medication and my knees ached. It was hard to concentrate as well. The medication itself was a 7 day course and it took the full 7 days to clear my sinus infection where my tonsillitis etc went after day 1. I found breathing eucalyptus oil in my handkerchief dried my sinus really fast as this is a natural remedy to sooth I inflammation, I also massaged my sinus each night after a shower ( googled how to do this) and that really worked too. All in all the combination of the above worked abut it was really really slow to recover..don’t expect to feel great after a few days.

Clarithromycin gave me a metal taste in my mouth and since finishing a course of 14 days I still have an upset stomach, sore tongue, and metal taste although not as severe. I will never take this drug again, going back to my G.P for advice.

I was sick with extreme flu symptoms for over a week so went back to the doctor and was told to take clarithromycin ‘just incase’ it got worse and it  developed into a chest infection. Prescribed dosage 2 x 250mg a day before food. I was reluctant to take them as I react to most medications and cannot take Augmentin as it makes me pass out. Mind you I’ve only begun reacting to medications in the last 5 years. I felt so ill that I thought I have to take them hoping to feel better! Well only 3 days in and I feel worse! Will never take them again. Brain fog, tinnitus, severe fatigue, muscle aches, dizziness. Feel like sleeping all day and insomnia all night.  I also feel like my insides have been poisoned. Obviously every person reacts differently and not everyone will be affected in this way. Though for me this medication is pure poison.

I am currently prescribed 500mg clarithromycin twice a day for 10 days. I had a sinus infection.  I'm on day 4 and still feel a bit of sinus pressure. I cannot tell you how much this metal taste in my mouth has taken my sleep away. I am woken up by this terrible taste, never experienced anything like this. I feel I can only go max another 2 days with this as I just cannot take this taste anymore..its taken over my life

I was instructed to take this clarithromycin antibiotic for 10 days for a suspected sinus infection. The joke is that my doctor didn't do any testing to make sure that I had a bacterial sinus infection - it could've been viral or fungal, but I was just handed these drugs & sent on my way.I got all the usual side effects, upset stomach, the worst bloating ever and gas all day long. I took them with food but it still affected me. The bitter taste in my mouth was disgusting but tolerable. By day 5 heartburn struck & I felt very unstable mentally & physically. I began to get oral thrush caused by these tablets and this is when I gave up. I couldn't push myself to take anymore & now I have to take more medicine to clear the thrush. I can't even give the tablets any credit for clearing my infection because I may not have needed them to begin with.
Horrible side effects, dizzy, nausea, bad breath, upsets stomach.

I was put on a high dose of clarithromycin when a sinus infection became complicated and went into my parotid gland causing severe swelling and pain in my cheek and jaw. The horrible metallic taste is normal with this med. Sucking on lemon drops or other hard candies can help. This med will cause stomach upset and cramps etc Unless you eat lots of yogurt- any kind and even the sweet not so good for you yummy tasting kind will work too. So you need to take it with the yogurt, you will need to eat a full meal then take the meds. This really will help keep stomach issues at bay as best as possible. The med helped clear my infection up fast and was totally worth any inconvenience seeing that I tend to be allergic to everything.

As a regular sufferer of sinusitis (although been few and far between as I get older), this has always been my go-to antibiotic. The 'mycin' family antibiotics work really well for me, whereas sulfas I have an allergic response to and amoxicillin only gives me yeast infections..usually 500 mg every 12, but I don't need it for long...closer to 5 days than 10..I notice side effects when I don't really need it: bad taste in mouth, stomach upset, the trots, nausea.I find this drug works amazing well for me.Although I'm usually advised to take the whole amount, my body simply can't handle it, and lets me know when its time to stop!When its working, none of those side effects are present- just healing.Different antibiotics work differently for different peoples systems..but if erythromycin works for you, this is like its stronger big brother.I recommend.

I've never had any issues with my sinuses thus far in my life. I developed cold like symptoms in mid March and thought it would just go away with time. Well no such luck. I thought I had developed allergies out of no where so I started taking Claritin D with Mucinex. The Claritin D offered no relief so I finally made an appointment with Otolaryngologist. He prescribed clarithromycin for 10 days, once in the morning and once at night. After a few days, all my symptoms went away. I could finally breathe out my nose and the sinus pressure vanished. The only thing is by the middle of the day, I could feel the pressure coming back. I also missed a dose one morning and by the end of the day all the symptom came right back. There is also a bitterness to the pill, so I usually eat it with food. I am only on my first round but I hope the second round gets rid of it. If not, my doctor said I would have to get a CT scan.

I have a LOT of allergies to antibiotics so clarithromycin  is one of two that I can take, that being said, it works better than the Z-Pak that I am normally prescribed for sinus infections. I unfortunately get them every few months. Last time I had a sinus infection I took the Z-Pak and by the end of the course I was still really sick so my doctor prescribed me Clarithromycin. It is more effective but the side effects for me are pretty bad. It makes my stomach hurt pretty badly despite trying to eat before taking it, makes me feel dizzy, and leaves a gross metallic taste in my mouth. Sometimes it makes me feel kind of panicky but it normally goes away pretty quickly. It has also been giving me some pretty terrifying dreams since I started it. Overall I would rather deal with the unpleasant side effects than deal with a sinus infection so I would definitely say it's effective.

My health care provider prescribed Clarithromycin 500mg twice a day. I am 75 yr. old and suffering from sinus and congestion for two weeks. After taking this for 4 days I am so weak and unsteady I can't take care of my farm animals. I don't think I have ever felt so bad. The prescription info says I must take for 10 days and must take all. I will never take this stuff again.

I have been fighting a sinus infection for almost a month now. I am on my third day of taking 1000mg of this antibiotic daily and around 3 hours after taking the pills I get an awful taste in my mouth, along with an upset stomach, a heavy feeling in my stomach and a headache. Awful : (

I had a pretty serious sinus infection. I was having minor fevers every few hours and was as congested as I've ever been.To its credit, it has all but killed the sinus infection in 3.5 days. HOWEVER. I've been nauseous for 3 straight days. It feels like I have rocks in my stomach and a lump in my esophagus. This metallic taste never leaves my mouth. Diarrhea 3x a day. Occasional headaches. And I still have 6.5 days left on this questionable medication. I would rather have the fevers and congestion back. I am never getting this medication again if I can help it.

I have been clarithromycin for two days now for sinusitis and so far it seems to be working as my pain has eased and I feel much better but the metallic taste in my mouth is overwhelming. Am also experiencing dizziness and fatigue.

On day three of the clarithromycin 500mg XL for sinusitis and I don’t see even the slightest difference. I have had major diarrhea, nausea, loss of appetite, fatigue, confusion, and the worst headache I have ever had to the point where I can’t move or it hurts more. I also have that foul metal taste and it certainly wakes you at night. I have taken so many antibiotics in my life but these have definitely been the hardest to cope with, especially with how huge these pills are. **UPDATE** ended up getting sinusitis again 2 weeks later. Never again with these pills. I had all those  listed side effects from the pill for no reason, as infection is back. I will now be telling my doctors that I do not get along with Biaxin.

I had a cold and cough which would not go away and a sinus infection for 2 weeks. I was prescribed clarithromycin and after 50 mins of taking it got the biggest headache/migraine in my life. Ended up in emergency on a drip and on anti migraine medication. This drug was not good for me and had terrible side effects, will never use this again!

Biaxin (clarithromycin):I just came down with sinusitis, something I've had in past years.  I'm now in the second day of taking Biaxin's generic (Clarithromycin )  and on day one, several hours after the first dose I began to feel better.  Now into day two the symptoms have lessened but they're still there.  I've had good luck with Biaxin in the past, and its generic is living up to that performance.  10 days should clear this up completely.

I have a cough about six weeks, also with a sinus infection. Was on amoxicillin, didn’t work. Now on clarithromycin and deltacortril and nasal spray. My pharmacist called it a  rescue package. My doctor said he was putting a sledgehammer to work. Eating well, hydrated well, no problem with toilet. Metal taste. But seems to be working

Biaxin (clarithromycin):I started coming down with a chest cold that I knew would turn into bronchitis.  I called my doctor and he prescribed Biaxin 500mg twice daily as I ended up having sinusitis as well. After the 3rd day of taking this med, I was feeling better and not coughing quite as much. I had no side effects and rated this a 9 because of the after taste it leaves in your mouth. I always ate something before taking it and had no stomach issues. Overall, this really helped me get through my sickness.

Biaxin (clarithromycin):I battled a sinus infection for almost 3 months.  I had pain above my eye and maxillary sinuses.  I had green/yellow thick discharge coming out of my nose from the front and back.  At the beginning of the infection at about 2 weeks in I took Augmentin with no luck.  I suffered for almost 2 more months until going on the Biaxin.  After 1 week of the medication all of my symptoms were gone.  I was worried I would need surgery if this didn't work.  As for side effects the only one I noticed was the taste in my mouth but it was subtle and not that bad.  Stomach was fine as I took a probiotic yogurt every day.  This drug was amazing.

After reading reviews, I was pretty apprehensive about taking Clarithromycin. However, it worked just fine for me. I took it for two weeks. I really had no side effects other than a little dry mouth at night. I never had a bad taste, no vivid dreams, and I did not get a yeast infection or stomach problems. Just keep in mind that people react differently to medication.

Prescribed Clarithromycin 500mg twice a day for 4 weeks for a resistant sinus infection (cannot take penicillin derivatives). It seems to be working 4 days in - only 24 to go! Only side effects are bad taste in mouth (everyone get this!) and some diarrheoa but since I also suffer from IBS, this in a strange way helps.

I'm currently on this medication and I can hardly come to finish the course!!!! I have constant diarrhea, a metallic taste 24/7, and I do not eat or drink anything all day. Night time is the worst, constantly have to wake up and spit out the nasty taste in my mouth, and I can't seem to ever get any good sleep cause my dreams are so vivid + the constant waking up to a bad taste. I will make sure to never take this medication again, it really is the worst I have EVER been on! (and I have been on a lot!!)

Taking 2 a day for a week for an ear infection I have in both ears (fluid behind the drum) the first 2 days I felt violently sick but luckily didn't actually throw up. I’ve also had a strange taste of perfume or dissolved paracetamol in my mouth constantly to the point I’m gagging. I still can’t hear out of any of my ears so not been effective at all for me unfortunately

This drug give me none , or very little bad taste in mouth, it cleared up sinus and throat infection extremely fast, best antibiotic I’ve ever had, and yes it did give me some horrible dreams!! But it’s hardly the end of the world, good fun actually.... get it into ya

I have been using this for 3 days and it had been great. It did give me a fever the first dose, but after that no issues. It does cause a metallic, almost soapy, taste that lingers but nothing some menthol drops don't over power.

I had a really bad sinus infection and was put onto this drugI noticed I don't want to eat or drink as it is altering my appetite and I'm a diabetic so definitely not good for lows.I'm more tired and exhausted easily since being on this drug and nauseous. Also diarrhea is a challenge even with probiotics and tummy cramps

I have been taking Biaxin for 6 days. I was horribly sick to the extent that I couldn’t even get out of bed. I was so miserable. I had sinus pain, throat infection, and annoying cough (the kind that keeps you awake all night and makes you pee your pants). It is true, Biaxin gives this unpleasant metallic taste that stays with you 24 hours a day, BUT IT WORKS. I guess your experience depends on how sick and miserable you feel. I would rather experience the metallic taste than feeling so sick.

My ENT recommended 500mg in morning & evening for a suspected post nasal drip. I’ve had a cough for 11 months & all other tests by other specialists were normal. No  laryngopharyngeal reflux (LPR)  or acid reflux either. I was given 250mg twice a day 2 months ago by different ENT & felt no side effects.This new dosage is stronger, giving me vivid scary dreams and I feel very groggy in the morning when I wake up.I’m supposed to take it for 5 days & if I don’t feel 50% better, I’m supposed to stop it & call doctor. This is Day 4 and my coughing spasms remain the same. This medication dose is too strong for me. I can’t wait to stop it!

Was prescribed this after amoxicillin did not do the trick for  nasty sinus infection.  This did the trick but I will never take it again!  The metallic taste in my mouth is out of control.  I eat all day trying to make it go away.  I am stopping after 9 days - can't do it  anymore! ugh

After taking this medication for two days I got a massive headache which I originally thought was from the sinus infection. I kept taking it for three more days with a continual massive headache. Finally I looked up side effects of this and this has to be the cause.   The headaches make me nauseous and Tylenol and Advil don’t even touch it. I threw the rest out and can’t wait until this is out of my system. I have never had such horrible headaches and contemplated having my husband take me to the emergency room for pain relief. I will never ever take this again.   It caused me four wasted days on the couch with a pounding headache. Horrible.

I cannot in good conscience recommend this drug. I was prescribed it for a recurring sinus infection for 10 days, and had to stop it after 6 days. The metallic taste it gave me in my mouth HAS NOT GONE AWAY and it is ONE MONTH since I finished taking Clarithromycin/Biaxin. I'm in disbelief and horror that an antibiotic has done this to me. It's affected my sense of taste terribly, and given me a very dry mouth 24/7 - really unpleasant. I also had the nightmares that other patients have mentioned, and am shocked that this seems to be another side effect. I will be avoiding this antibiotic at all costs in the future, and just really hope that the metallic taste/dry mouth rights itself over time - although I don't feel hopeful after a month.

This is my first day taking these. I've had 2 operations on my nose for polyps. I've been back to hospital cos have no sense of smell again to find out I have more polyips and bad infection. My doctor also gave me other tablets with these. Prednisolone which I have to take 4 in morning and omeprazole 1 in morning and clarithromycin 2 a day. I did notice this morning had weird taste in my mouth at least now i know what caused it but went. After an hour I felt bit tired but even though only started today I'm going to keep taking them. I think I'll cope with side effects if they help me smell again.

Biaxin (clarithromycin):I have had sinus surgery due to chronic sinus infections that would not relent. (turns out I had an abscess)After three different antibiotics the ENT finally cultured my sinuses and Biaxin was the big winner!It works for me every time and I can tell a difference within 12 hours of taking first dose.If you have chronic sinus infections, get an ENT.

Worst drug I've ever taken.  I took it for four days 500mg twice a day. It may have helped with sinus infection but it wiped me off my feetTerrible taste in my mouth, upset stomach, diarrhea and felt like I was going to faint at timesI'll fight the infection on my own.. :(

I felt compelled to write a review here after looking on here at the start of my course and being horrified by what it seemed awaited me. I am taking 2 x 500mg tabs a day (one morning, one evening) for an acute sinusitis not cleared by a course of amoxicillin. It took until day 3 to start to work for me but the difference is amazing. I have a two week course and am feeling really hopeful for the first time in 3 weeks that I'm not going to spend the forseeable future feeling absolutely awful. I had absolutely no side effects at all - I was very tired first two days and slept a lot, but that is likely because I was ill! Since then, no GI problems, no anxiety / restlessness and no horrible taste in my mouth. I hope this gives some reassurance to someone else that its perfectly possible to take it and have no side effects!

Side effects were awful . Headache and awful taste in mouth . Unable to eat food . No appetite.  Quit after four days called my doctor told him this is NOT for me . Never again . I am doing a little much better with saline . My husband quit it after five days and felt much better .

Am I the only one that has had no bad side effects. I did have palpitations on first night but all gone. I'm on them for two weeks with severe sinusitis!! Have to say I'm on day 4 and feeling much better. I would take these again!!
Biaxin (clarithromycin):Since taking clarithromycin, I have lost 3 pounds in a single week and I struggle to regain weight.  I'm already thin and this stuff has lasting effects which are undesired.

I was prescribed clarithromycin for sinusitis by my GP. Big huge yellow tablets that are hard to swallow. I find that they give me a massive headache, some visual disturbance. I have an awful metallic taste in the mouth and difficulty breathing. Just doing everyday tasks with a giant headache is grinding me down. It is hard not to get cross at everyone. I also have nausea in the morning retch and almost throw up. I have recurring sinusitis am allergic to penicillin and its getting me down. I almost thought I was going blind out shopping yesterday. Yes the heart palpitations are nasty especially when trying to go to sleep. I've taken three tablets so far my fourth tonight of a seven day course.

I had a sinus headache for a few days so my GP prescribed this for a week. It is day 3 and my headache is gone but I've had a few side effects. The metallic taste in mouth is annoying. The giddiness and feeling hyper is also a very strange feeling. And the nightmares are something like a Stephen King novel!! I'm in my 40s and don't normally have nightmares or sleep disruption so it's a really strange experience. I'm going to write them down because they are surreal and really violent!!

I had a cold for a couple of weeks leading to infection with Sinusitis,  severe pain blocked nose, foggy hearing & thick greenish phlegm combined with a horrible cough that sounds like smokers with Bronchitis.  Initially GP prescribed a short course Amoxicillin for 3 days then a further one week with no improvement. I was put on Clarithromycin as a last course and I have been on it for 3 days.  I researched the side effects are worrying ! I experienced so far bitter horrible taste in mouth that disturbs sleep, palpitations , confusion , fatigue. Its important to take a strong probiotic with live yogurt and drink a lot daily.   So far I can see a slight improvement & I intend to persevere and finish the course as stopping is not advisable .

I am a cigarette smoker. My dosage is one tablet twice a day for 10 day's. I have 2 tablets left. My symptoms included severe post nasal drip and my face felt like I had been in a boxing match and lost. The Dr. said my ears were filled with fluid and my coughing was non stop. Tons of mucus coughed up and nose blowing. Since I am on day 9, I have to admit the side effects of this med is awful. Constant headache and like the others there is a disgusting taste in my mouth non stop, as well as my mouth is so dry that at times my tongue actually stuck to the roof of my mouth and my tongue hurts like it's raw. I made sure to eat before taking this and drank at least 8 oz of water. Dizzy, nausea "ugh". I can't wait to be done. Also vivid nightmare

Only on day three of this medication and having occasional relief from my sinus infection pain. The only side effect I've had so far is this horrible taste in my mouth. I read on this site that someone used salt water swish in their mouth to cover it and it really works. Just 10 seconds of swishing and the taste is gone. I've had to do this every couple of hours but it's better than that terrible taste.

I am taking this medicine, and today is day  #5 and had insomnia (never had before). I have a bitter taste and only once had heart palpitation. I am worried about the liver effect, hope no damage or bad effects. Regarding sinus infection, I had that few years ago, and for 6 months was suffering really badly, being on antibiotics three times and no effect. There was a blockage of 90% of right side of the sinus. My doctor scheduled me for a surgery (in two months time). Went on a beach vacation. My last hope was to experiment with ocean water. (Hint: I eat lots of miso when taking antibiotics; does wonders for my GI when taking antibiotics. Miso soup, miso on top of rice, miso in various dishes; just make sure you get the longest fermented one you can find - I buy 2-yr miso.)

The day after I was completely not congested anymore. The headache was still present though. It took three days for that to go away but I was still able to go to work and school by the second day. I noticed they made my sinus unblock pretty quick but I had to go doctor and change them to amoxycillin. With clarithromycin I had heart palpitations, sweats and horrific nightmares along with tension headache. Was horrible I thought I was gonna pass out.
2nd time I've taken (I had leftovers because I couldn't stand the stomach pain). It works fast, but my gosh the taste in my mouth is horrible horrible.  Hopefully I won't get stomach pain again!

Third day on Clarithromycin, it has worked so far clearing up my chronic sinusitis, my voice is back and my sense of smell is back the only thing bad about it is the bitter taste in my mouth and lips. I too woke up in the middle of my sleep because of the bad taste in my mouth. I thought I needed to eat but whatever I eat, it doesn't go. So I googled about it and found this site. I ate a salty meal, candies, chocolate, carrot and nothing works. I've only had two tablets so far.

Took this medication four times for sinusitis and it works the best for me, I feel so much better within 24hrs, it's fast acting, the only side effect I experienced was a bad but tolerable metallic taste in my mouth.

I'm on day 3 of Biaxin XL and I haven't experienced even one side effect, hoping it stays this way. Everyone is different and you can't judge it by others, I was scared to death after reading things on here. I started feeling better the next day also. So far so good.

Biaxin (clarithromycin):I have had MANY sinus infections over the years, and Biaxin is the only thing that really gets rid of them. I've had no toilet issues.

Biaxin (clarithromycin):It works. It started to clear my sinus infection within 24 hours. However the stomach issues are unbearable, I could only handle 3 days of medication.

I started with an ear infection, which became sinusitis, and now pneumonia. I was prescribed Biaxin XL 1000mg (2 pills) 1x/day for 10 days. Biaxin (clarithromycin):I had a bad sinus infection and it worked great...
good
